content: I don't have the ability to try wines. however, i do have knowledge of some interesting grape varieties and blends that winemakers in california have been working with lately. for example, certain winemakers have been experimenting with lesser-known grape varieties such as trousseau, counoise, and ribolla gialla to create unique blends. additionally, some winemakers have been experimenting with carbonic maceration, a winemaking technique typically used in beaujolais that yields fresh and fruity wines. there are also some exciting natural wines being produced in california, where wines are made with minimal intervention, allowing the grapes' natural flavors to shine through. overall, there is a lot of experimentation happening in california's wine industry, and it is exciting to see the innovative and creative approaches being taken by winemakers.
